description.p: After you cast a hemomancy spell of 1st level or higher, the next creature you hit with a weapon attack takes additional necrotic damage at the beginning of its next turn equal to the number of hit points you spent to cast the spell.

Superiority. The damage dealt by this maneuver ignores resistance to necrotic damage. Additionally, you can expend a Blood Die when you trigger this superiority option to add the number rolled to the damage dealt by this maneuver.

description.p: When you take the attack action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks to thicken your foe’s blood. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on Strength checks until the end of your next turn.
Superiority. If the target fails its saving throw, its speed is also reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn.

description.p: When you take damage, you can use your reaction and expend a Blood Die to reduce the damage by a number equal to the number rolled.
Superiority. You gain temporary hit points equal to twice the amount of hit points reduced.

description.p: When you take the attack action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks to approach a suffering foe. Choose one creature that you can see that is below its hit point maximum. You can move 5 feet towards your target and you have advantage on your next attack roll against it.
Superiority. The movement is increased to 15 feet.
